snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown intervened in the stalled negotiations, ordering a seven-day inquiry into the labor dispute, which guaranteed service for the Monday commute.
abstract: Strike by employees of San Francisco's Bay Area Rapid Transit System is averted after California Gov Jerry Brown intervenes in the stalled negotiations, guaranteeing train service for seven days; two unions representing the employees are fighting to preserve their members' comparatively generous public pensions and health coverage; if agreement is not reached within seven days, Brown will decide on management's request for a 60-day cooling-off period, during which negotiations and train service would continue.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown intervened in the stalled negotiations, ordering a seven-day inquiry into the labor dispute, which guaranteed service for the Monday commute.

headline.main: Governor Intervenes at Last Minute to Forestall a New Bay Area Transit Strike
headline.print_headline: Governor Intervenes at Last Minute to Forestall a New Bay Area Transit Strike
